intro: Trinia leiogona, commonly known as the smooth-leaved trinia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Trinia leiogona thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. It is an important plant in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
